Good and fun for SAO fans, easy to use, hard to learn. Always makes steam think it was opened, unlike software like "Wallpaper engine"

Nicely responsive, UI very similar to the show, and again, easy to use.

Even if you don't like the show or even if you have never heard of it this utility(yes its a utility to run in the background and forget about not a game) is create for creating shortcuts or displaying wanted information like resources your computer is using, the weather, and even show updates. it takes some time to get used to and customize it to your needs and or wants but its great. it might not be something for everyone but you wont be disappointed if you take the time to use it to its fullest potential.

This software is just.... amazing, No words for it... It gives a highly interactive feeling while not taking up much cpu resources, I can see how amazing this was before, Highly customisable, some language barriers but still working amazing, then I found out that these new updates are too good and arent for sao only, For example, Legend of zelda, botw, Solo Levelling, Cyberpunk edgerunners, most of the SAO widgets, and additional addons. So here is the main deal, what are the negatives? Only thing i remember was the language barrier, but apart for that, there was some glitching and bugs in the setup menu, apart for that, the entire system was perfect
Very good app especially if you know how to edit all the widgets to make your desktop look really nice
This is probably one of the personal computer software ever made

welp i guess im gonna die as a beta tester

this app is really something else. although i barley have a few dozen hours on this game i can assure its worth every cent. the freedom and the infinite possibilities that are provided here are truly amazing. as a sword art online fan i really am proud to be able to call myself a beta tester of this software and get access to such amazing features that allows your pc to be infinitly cooler and easier to use. the only downside of this app is that there isn't any good tutorial to explain the basics that are pretty easy to understand, and specially when the thing you are trying to achieve get more complicated, but for me it was experience, after alot of fails and successes i slowly but surly i got the hang of it and now understand to pretty much do anything my heart desires. now about the achievement i finally got it and proud to have 3/4 achievements. the only one left is becoming a "SAO SURVIVOR". i dont really know what i need to do to complete it but i guess i will when the time comes to it, the rest of the achievements are pretty easy to get,  you just have to log out from the menu to get the "beta tester". and the rest i just got randomly. anyway thanks for taking your time and read this message.  i wish you the best of luck with whatever challenges may come ahead, my fellow SAO survivors ;D

yes

After Over 2 Long years, I finally achieved it. I am An SAO Survivor. With that being said, That means I've had to have been running the game for a while. As A Sword Art online fan, this is worth the buy in its entirety. The AI feels Exactly like in the anime or novel (For you Manga Readers out there :D) And Overall I do use this game daily. There are some bits that can take some getting used to but overall this is worth the money. As For myself, I dont write a lot of reviews for games, but this one takes a special cake. To my fellow SAO Survivors, There leaves one achievement left, The beater. I Still have no idea what Itll take to really achieve it, or if it is obtainable anymore, frankly because The beater role was given to one person, So Whats to say the achievement wasnt the same? Or maybe a beta key? Or Even This Year when The Nerve Gear would be released. Its Insane to think back when I first got this, My love life, My family life, My own Life, All rapidly Changing. I will Try to unlock you one day beater, but as for now I sit in my house, and like klien, im gonna enjoy myself a pizza after clearing Sword Art Online. Thank You all For Having me and reading this long paragraph of a message. Stay Safe, and I love you all.
From
TheDragonFox

Update: After Years, I have Achieved The beater role! I am Now a beta tester. For everyone else who achieves this, Congratulations On being one of the few beta testers to achieve this! I am So happy. I figured it out before the announcement went public and cried when i saw it appear, I was actually shocked. You have to be a beta player (AKA SAO in the anime today would be in its beta stage, so if you logout during this little event phase (August 1st through 31st) you gain access to this achievement, it wont be unlockable after this SO UNLOCK IT WHILE YOU CAN! FROM ONE BETA TESTER TO ANOTHER! Its been such a fun ride, and ill keep using this for a long long while. Thank you Aincrad for being a stable place in my life. A staple of a memory.

I think this is a good product provided you take time to learn how to use it and go out of your way to make it functional for yourself. Like any device meant to create simplicity, it takes time to setup and it can be complicated to do that at times. Same with any smart home, when setting it up, it can be frustrating trying to sync everything, but once it works, your life is easier.

I use the menu system as a way to make my life easier and my computer cleaner. Navigation for my computer is faster and much more organized using this software. I have discord, GOG Galaxy, and other assorted applications that I want open in my computer regularly, all set to boot using the menu by changing the directory the icons are assigned at default.

The software requires time and attention and can be good if you give the time it needs for setup and plugin management. However, the software not being primarily English obviously makes using this software to it's full extent, difficult. This is something that needs to be addressed by the developers, and if it is, I can give a solid and good recommendation. This isn't just English, but translation for multiple languages is necessary.

However even with 2,500 hours into this app, I feel as though because it is not fully translated, I am limited from the apps full capability. If the devs can translate and add more personalization as opposed to plugin supported theme options to change the game theme from SAO to GGO, I would be able to give it a good recommendation once these issues are addressed. There are not enough guides for full customization or personalization, and the settings menu is not extremely intuitive. These are my complaints, but overall, I use this every day and only offer criticisms because I would like to see it improve.

Pretty awesome app. As a computer nerd who likes to customize their desktop, this is a really neat program, especially in combination with wallpaper engine. Even if you aren't a fan of SAO, you might find this pretty fun to mess around with as it's very customizable. You can essentially get all the data from task manager but within a UI on your desktop that mimics either health bars or data tables. Huge fan of this program so far. My only recommendation would be to change how it runs in the background. Unlike wallpaper engine, it's constantly running as a game being played on Steam. This can cause complications when using steam under the same account on multiple devices. Other than that, I have no other requests. Keep up the awesome work and a huge thanks for delivering this!

It doesn't use a single bit of my CPU and it's not even taking 1/800 of my RAM, while I only have 8Gb, so it's not performance hungry. It takes a bit of time to get used to it, but once you get the hang of things, it's one of the most usefull thing I've download for my PC. The steam version is quite a bit awful because it can't launch automatically, but that's a minor problem. I really like to use it and if I knew a thing or two about programming, I could probably use even more things on it.

However, most of the guides/help you can get aren't written in english so it's a bit odd to find help when you need it.

Probably really the only program for fans of anime in the steam that you can use. All fans or just fans of Sword Art Online are recommended to purchase. But be careful, the program is quite voracious and consumes a lot of system resources, especially it is necessary to monitor this for owners of low-power PC.

Enjoy!

This is a very helpful and enjoyable desktop menu that helps with everyday tasks in style. I use it instead of having apps on my desktop, and It's just fine. Minimal bugs for an early access title, and a great feeling especially for long time fans of the show. If you want the Original SAO or Alfheim sounds instead of the GGO ones you just have to open the menu, go to sounds, then presets, and choose Alfheim or SAO. Then click save and you have the sounds of the original menu! 9/10 would recommend

Ya like SAO? Yes? Prepare the $4 now before alicization comes around, who knows what may happen there.

To be honest, this is like extra visuals for your desktop. If configured correctly, it can act as some good-looking shortcuts to Steam and such. Otherwise, there is the health bars which indicate CPU, RAM, and GPU usage but i'm not too sure on the last one.
Anyway, if this all sounds interesting to you, get it. I highly recommend such a cool little software. There is actually a free version of this on the web, but steam workshop exists here. Getting mods elsewhere is pretty sketch imo, so use the free one at your own risk. I've tried it but I have to say this one is slightly better overall.

Also the steam workshop here is kinda small so we need some people to get on that lol.

TL;DR: This is a fun little software. Get it if you want to spice up your desktop a bit.

Initially I used the free version of this software, but I loved it so much that I purchased it on steam. Currently, this is a fantastic looking system, and though I don't find myself using the menu, music, and chat systems that this software, I still think this is a great option if you're looking for something to spice up your desktop.

I never really used the chat option, since I'm sure many people in the west aren't familiar with QQ, but if there was some kind of integration with Twitter or Discord, that would be the icing on top of the cake for a large amount of people. Maybe some integration with Spotify would be fantastic too, but I'm not sure how difficult it would be to add all of this in.

Overall, I highly recommend. I'm now patiently waiting for that VR version that was shown a while ago.

I don't like SAO, but this is great.
It's overall pretty easy to use and navigate, although I didn't fully understand some design choices and customizing it was kind of a pain at first. The E-mail system in this was a bit confusing at first too.

It's not very resource heavy, the CPU and Ram usage is surprisingly low. I am running this together with Wallpaper Engine and the difference between having both on or off is minimal.
It works really well with my dual monitor setup. Unfortunately, I had it crash once, but that is something I can tolerate as long as it doesn't happen regularly.

The most irritating thing is seeing all the other reviews of people who seem to not understand many parts of the software or call it unusable by users from the west.
The browser is being closed by clicking the icon in the top left, I don't know why. I found that out pretty fast since that's the first thing I tried when searching for the 'x' to close, but I get that it's not really obvious. It may be a cool design choice, if it was explained or mentioned somewhere at all.

Also, people are talking about this needing a translation, which is confusing since the software is fully in english for me. Seriously, in all my time using it I didn't find anything in japanese aside from a single button in the menu. That said, this button just brings you to an japanese website and that japanese writing you see is just the name of the site. That one weird window that's on the top left when you first boot up that probably shows which animes are on TV at which time can be set to english by pressing the 'i' icon left of the refresh button in the top right. Upon pressing a window is shown in which you should place a hook at 'Prefer local translation name'.

If your not a Sword art online fan, this is still incredibly awesome to have.

It uses far less resources than ANY similar program on steam.

completely customizable.

The in-game status (showing in-game on steam) can be disabled in the menu, but I "kinda" like it.

The video on the store page shows you exactly what it is. A fully custumizable sao launcher for your desktop. You can write your own commands, links to file locations. start programs like steam, spitify, discord, and games all while using the sao launcher. This program can also be running at the same time as "wallpapper engine" for cool combo's. My only complaint is that the built in news feed and chat are not english and i dont know how to personalize the news feed. Besides that everything is in english so enjoy.
Cool program, will be refunding until it's in english though sadly

I have tried this thing years ago way before it was on steam, and to be honest there are a lot of improvements. Its greatest strength and weakness is its customisability. It allows the user to edit each widget to show what they want, but it does require a lot of time and effort to set it up the way you want, and the official instructions are poorly made for newer users. 

It's a great utility tool that requires effort, but worth it. 

For new users, I would strongly suggest looking up guides on youtube instead of scouting on their website.

This review has been edited because the user Moji helped me find the english manual, you have to right click on the program on steam go to properties then local files and browes local files after that you scroll down till you find the english version text file and go on from there. The software looks nice but a con is that all the links they have is in chinese and even the event logs i hope in a later update they translate these for the english users so we can enjoy the full thing without understanding what they say. Other than that it runs well and seems great.

Also a sugestion for the developers, maybe think about adding an option to the chat room where you can select what language chat room you can join. Right now its a bunch of chinese and few english, but if you have different chat rooms then it would be easier to talk to people who speak and understand the same langauge as you.

I like this software, especially with the 3D interface that this people did. Well got a few word to say here.

Pros:
-You can switch between 2D & 3D interface
-It has a server where you can talk to people in the world
-You can put your photo on the screen (I think you should use PNG files for this)
-It has 2 themes so far (SAO and GG0)
-Has VR feature
-3D browser look sick as f**k
-And it's fairly cheap

Now let's talk about the cons.

Cons:
-We all know that we need an english patch
-Took some time to understand how things works
-It may decrease your fps tremendously
especially with the 3D feature

If you have a badass computer that can run multiple web, go buy this software. If you have a potato pc like me, well it's up to you. If you're asking me how to edit stuff, well don't, I don't have any idea what the tutorial says cause they're not english so no.

This is just amazing....

It can do almost everything that you normally would do, but in a more awesome way! It has its own website(or that's what im guessing), it has a media player(supposedly, i cant find a way to get it working, but hey...its still in beta!), and it has just general information you'd need like: weather, humidity, etc.
I really have no words for how good and amazing it looks, but almost everything is in japanese! And i couldn't understand anything(exept for the parts that are in english ofc).

I definetly reccommend this to a huge fan towards SAO or for just any weeb really...but beware, you probably can use it to its full extent unless you can read japanese(at least for now).
I really do hope they make a full english option
Highly not recommended

I really like SAO and this utility, this program is so cool. So many things to choice. Very nice and for sure I will use it in future. But It's in great need of more clear informations. Tutorials, etc. Of course there are some on internet, sure. Sometimes I just don't know what I'm lookin' at.

SAO Utils is a fair and easy to use program that can really make using your laptop if touchscreen a 1 stop shop with the slide down menu. It makes image previewing fun and intuitive when you can have your videos and such playing right on your desktop at an easy few taps. It is highly customizable and the price it has set is way too modest for the service and boundless limits it offers in editting, plug-in creation and much more. 

This should be a highly sought after program to have because it will be something for the average anime lover / SAO fan to enjoy and something or the tech-savvy to enjoy with making stuff for it.

[h1] To 尚未购买的玩家	[/h1]
[list]
    [*]SAO Utils不是一款下载下来就能流畅使用的软件，部分内容都需要自己编辑
    [*]如果你在犹豫是否购买，可以在[url=sao.gpbeta.com] 这里	[/url]浏览项目介绍
    [*]展示视频/图片的效果通过编辑都是可以做到的
[/list]
[h1] To 刚刚购买一脸懵逼的玩家	[/h1]
[list]
    [*]创意工坊中有大量优秀资源可以利用
    [*]桌面聊天室可以在首选项-插件中关闭
    [*]请耐心使用该软件
[/list]
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[h1] To Players not yet purchased	[/h1]
[list]
    [*]SAO Utils is not a software that can be used rapidly. Some contents need to be edited by yourself.
    [*]If you are hesitant to purchase, you can browse the project [url=sao.gpbeta.com] here	[/url].
    [*]The effect of displaying videos/pictures can be achieved through editing
[/list]
[h1] To Players who just bought	[/h1]
[list]
    [*]There are plenty of excellent resources available in the workshop
    [*]Web Widget can be closed in Preferences - Plugin-ins
    [*]Please use this software with patience.
[/list]
